snippet: In what appeared to be a spate of sectarian-motivated violence, a car bomb and a roadside bomb exploded during the culmination of one of Shiite Islam’s holiest rituals.
abstract: Attackers kill at least 32 pilgrims in Iraq in what appears to be spate of sectarian-motivated violence as country continues to struggle with political crisis in its fractured government; deaths occur at end of annual mourning period for death of Imam Hussein ibn Ali, Shiite religious observance banned while Saddam Hussein was in power

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: In what appeared to be a spate of sectarian-motivated violence, a car bomb and a roadside bomb exploded during the culmination of one of Shiite Islam’s holiest rituals.

headline.seo: Attacks in Iraq Kill at Least 32 Pilgrims
headline.main: 32 Pilgrims Are Killed by Bombings in Central Iraq
headline.print_headline: 32 Pilgrims Are Killed By Bombings In Central Iraq
